intro: Echioides obtusifolia, commonly known as the blunt-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces showy yellow flowers with surrounding white or pale green ray florets. Its leaves are broad, heart-shaped, and have a distinctive blunt tip. Echioides obtusifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its hardy nature and attractive appearance.
